intro: Dugandiodendron argyrothrichum, commonly known as the silver-haired tree, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its lanceolate leaves that are covered in a dense layer of silvery-white hairs, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in humid, lowland areas and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The bark and leaves of this plant have been traditionally used in folk medicine for their purported therapeutic properties.
